name: prestigiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is respected and admired very much : This tournament is rated more prestigiously in South Africa than any other. The lifestyles of the elite are seen as prestigiously and fashionably luxurious.
More examplesFewer examplesVenice's former Customs House is prestigiously situated just across from the Piazza San Marco.She was carrying a long, prestigiously wrapped and labelled box of expensive Belgian chocolates. Their family has a prestigiously long list of famous ancestors, of whom they are very proud.
